page.title: 05THE AREA OF WOODSEAT
page.content: Woodseat was a Garden Centre for 12 years, and only closed down very recently. Mr.A.Nash who owns Woodseat, has 12-14 acres, although the Garden Centre used to cover 1200 acres. The majority of this acreage was covered with trees, although a wide variety of plants,flowers,shrubs and fruits were also grown. Today, Mr.Nash keeps only a few plants as his own. Woodseat was once the property of Colin Minten Campbell who was the founder of Minten china. Mr.Nash has a few Minten plates and also a porcelain statue of Campbell. Campbell set up his own business making Minten pots. His father was also born on the estate, but the original house is now only a ruin, so the Nash family have constructed several new buildings for their previous business and as their home.
